wikipedia_page.main:
David Houston Will  (20 November 1936 – 25 September 2009) was a Scottish association football administrator who held a number of prominent positions.
A solicitor by profession, Will was chairman of Brechin City for two decades, before becoming president of the Scottish Football Association (the governing body of Scottish football) and a vice-president of FIFA (the governing body of world football).He was awarded a CBE in the 2002 Birthday Honours for services to association football.Will died of cancer in September 2009 at the age of 72.

response: * David Will CBE, Vice-President from 1990 to 2007 of FIFA.
* 25 September – David Will, 72, Brechin City chairman, Scottish Football Association president and FIFA vice-president.
*David Will, 72, British vice president of FIFA, former Brechin City F.C. chairman, cancer.

Aberdeen returned to Scotland to face Brechin City in a memorial match for former Brechin City chairman David Will on 4 August 2010. The result was a 2–2 draw, Fraser Fyvie and Andrew Considine scored for Aberdeen.
* David William Thorne. Ranger, Country Park, Sandringham Estate.
* David William Rooke. For services to Flood Defence and to the Environment. (York, North Yorkshire)

A question and answer session was held at the congress the day before the election in which Blatter refused to allow Hayatou and the FIFA Vice-President David Will to take part. Delegates booed Blatter afterwards and Blatter and Hayatou were involved in a verbal confrontation. Will was described as "shaking with rage" by reporters.
